messages.message:
Note to everyone who see changes in their `vendored` submodule in git — please do one of these two things:
• run anywhere: `git submodule update --init --recursive`  OR
• run in any directory with a Makefile `make git-update-go`
Feel free to shoot me a message if you can’t seem to make that change go away

For context: Vendored is where all the golang third-party libraries are stored. We added a new go third-party library a few days ago. The Instabase git repo is now pointing to a newer version of the submodule (newer hash). And until you run `git submodule update --init --recursive` on your own master, your tree will continue to point at an older submodule hash. And if you check that PR in, you’ll end up reverting the addition of the new library.

The steps to properly update:
```
git checkout master
git pull 
git submodule update —init —recursive
git checkout yourbranch
git rebase master
```
